description: Feeding activity peaks on prime days of the lunar cycle.
pollus_notes: 67% of feeding-to-resting transitions occur on prime-day intervals. This is the foundational pattern.

description: Yeller-compatible creatures form stable groups of five.
pollus_notes: Groups of 4 or 6 are statistically underrepresented and unstable. Five is the dominant stable configuration.

description: Successful trapping yields prime-numbered catches 58% of the time.
pollus_notes: Catches of 4, 6, 8, or 9 are statistically underrepresented. The trappers noticed this generations ago.

description: Stone Spine Lizards emerge to bask every seventh day.
pollus_notes: Seven-day periodicity holds regardless of weather. Some environmental constraint at work.

description: Quarry-wide silence precedes major events by approximately eleven minutes.
pollus_notes: The eleven-minute duration appears repeatedly. Too precise for coincidence, too strange for explanation.

description: Eel activity peaks at the 11th and 23rd hours.
pollus_notes: The eleventh hour. The trappers knew this long before I arrived.

description: Tunnel cats hunt in groups of three.
pollus_notes: Solitary cats rest; paired cats travel; three cats hunt. Another prime signature.

description: Leatherback Burrowers prefer prime-numbered depths.
pollus_notes: Mode depths of 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13 meters. The depth preference is real.

description: Stakdur hunting and swarming both peak on prime days.
pollus_notes: The rule distinguishes hunting (1-2 creatures) from swarming (many). Count before you commit.

description: Cave Bat swarms exhibit 5-day periodicity within lunar cycles.
pollus_notes: My discovery, not in the folk rules. Swarms cluster every 5 days during active periods.

description: Bat feeding bouts cycle on 3-day intervals.
pollus_notes: Statistically significant. Novel discovery from Pattern Book analysis.

description: Yeller-compatible creatures form groups in prime numbers.
pollus_notes: Statistically significant. Grigsu observed this forty years ago. Folk knowledge predates my analysis.

description: Maw Beast hunting cycles show weak 7-day periodicity.
pollus_notes: Weak evidence; requires more data. Novel discovery from Pattern Book analysis.

description: Predator activity peaks on prime days across species.
pollus_notes: Statistically significant. Grigsu observed this forty years ago. Folk knowledge predates my analysis.
